results.name: Number of Lipschitz quaternions X such that X^2 == 1 (mod n).
comment: A quaternion q = a + bi + cj + dk is congruent to 1 (mod n) iff a == 1 (mod n) and b == c == d == 0 (mod n).
mathematica: cuaternios[n_] := Flatten[Table[{{a, -b, d, -c}, {b, a, -c, -d}, {-d, c, a, -b}, {c, d, b, a}}, {a, n}, {b, n}, {c, n}, {d, n}], 3]; invo[n_] := invo[n] = Length@Select[cuaternios[n], Mod[#.# - IdentityMatrix[4],n] == 0*# &]; Table[invo[n], {n, 1, 25}]
results.author: _José María Grau Ribas_, Nov 02 2013
